messageBody:
Harbir, please read my inline comments. :)

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Harbir Singh Hundal <hshundal@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Frank!
> I have used JUNIT in testin the webapplication, and it did a great
job for me, well the time increase for testing the application does
not increase considerably, and it will depend the way the testing is
carried, if testing is considered in the initial phases, then it is
likely to take less, rather than incoorporating it at later stages.

[Frank] I cannot agree with you more in that doing it at the beginning
would make it much easier. Actually, i have been reviewed some of the
code my team wrote. Since no one really thought about testability, it
is very difficult to ADD testing code unless we can do big
refactorying, which is impossible for our case.


> One best use of JUNIT I have found is that the major test can be
run during the start-up of the application, which is a nice feature,
and it reduces lot of surprises.
> Well, this is all I am say about JUNIT, in my view, I think JUNIT
definitly has long term benefits.
>

[Frank] This is a point I've never thought of. Thanks for sharing. :)

Cheers,
- Frank
